description: My boyfriend an I come here a lot. It's a chill place of you wanna relax an smoke it up. If I lived closer I'd come here more! Love it good vibes here! Friendly staff an decently priced!
author: Jesse G.

description: the hookah was good here and the service was good except the coals were set more in the middle than on the side but they did come check on them.  the only other thing is the atmosphere isn't like pictured. looks like it can use some touch ups in the place but again hookah was good and decently priced.
author: Natasha D.

description:
This hookah is smooth!!!  Although mine got quite a bit of ash coming up.  It's a bit more than I would have liked, but I ha d a great time so I'm willing to pay a bit more than I expected for awesome atmosphere and music.

I had white peach with two friends and it was very nice.  They also have candy at the front which is a nice touch, but no bubbles(boo!)  

This lounge is nice and large so you don't feel super cramped(yay!) and Zach plays the best music..."ahhh Habibi!"
author: Kat D.

description: This was our first experience here and this will be our last. The "manager" was rude (the one with glasses). They have no business card to get a hold of the owner. They give no refunds if a guest is unsatisfied. What kind of customer service is that?
author: Ciara A.

description:
Lalaloooooveee this place! Totally beats every hookah joint I've been to in SF. I have been loyal to Cairo Nights but this is by far the best one. Reasons why:

-Good, friendly, and fast service
-Flavors are amaaaaazing!! Get #12 from the house special menu. Comes with strawberry, watermelon, and mint, I think. It's delicious
-Ambiance is cool; Lighting isn't too dark
-Spacious with lots of places to sit
-They play Arabic music! If you're lucky, you'll get to see customers dance!

Just a warning, if you're looking for or expecting a huge ass sign that says "724 Hookah" on the storefront, you won't find it. It says "Cheap Cigarettes" or something like that on it. Why it has that instead of what it's called is beyond me. The easiest way to locate this spot is to remember that it is right next to a Pizza Hut. The one that has its windows covered with billowing curtains. Yep, that's the one.

Grab all your friends, take a seat, and puff, puff, pass! :)
author: Michelle B.

description: Customer service is really great! Good service and great tasting hookah! Recommend this hookah bar to everyone. Great location too!!!
author: Zasha M.

description: 724 music was very good, played hip hop which I enjoyed. But needs a little ventilation in that place.
author: Matthew B.

description: This place is legit. I took my date on a first date here and we are having so much fun. I love hookah. It was her first and she's loving it. We smoked the lemon mint and we probably will smoke more!
author: Kamuran K.

description: Kind of a funny place as far as hookah lounges go.  I like the gangster rap videos... But I just prefer to smoke outdoors. Good place. Vibe is dope. Just make sure you like hip hop
author: James T.

description:
Best hookah lounge in SF... great ambiance, great service, great staff, great flavors and the BEST HOOKAHS! They also play cool videos and good music. I love this place, they keep coming by with coals and the hookah hits real smooth. Did I mention they have great prices?!!! 

Thank you 724 hookah for giving me such a great experience.
author: Azizi A.

description: Best hookah place in SF! I had so much fun tonight !! I will definitely be coming back again and the service was great! Everyone was so friendly! Met some awesome people
author: Yasmine P.

description:
Stopped by last night for their grand opening, and these guys are cool as f***!!!!
Seriously......great service, delicious hookah, cool music, and a friendly, good looking crowd. Perfect spot for you to chill and get a hookah while waiting for your friends to show up so you guys can go hit the clubs......and perfect spot to sober up and finish up the night after clubbin....I think they're open til 3am, at least on weekends.
author: Ocee D.

description: Good hookah. Good atmosphere. Nice staff.  Little expensive but what isn't in San Francisco.
author: Kate C.

description: Was not that impressed with this Shisha bar. Was expecting better from San Fran, atmosphere was dingy and seedy with fowl bathrooms and the shisha itself was poor quality.
author: Amanda M.

description: Terrible service. They did not replace our coals once. They put us write by the door where the wind kept coming back and even though we asked the security to keep the door closed 3 times it was open for the most part. The hookahs are over priced, about $30-$40 for only 1 refill?!?!?!? None of the staff pays attention to you unless you nag them constantly until they listen. I am willing to spend a lot on hookah, usually in the $80s range if the quality is right, I don't care much about the price. But this is a place that takes the fun out of hookah.
author: Matthew M.

description: I had the best time and the hookah was great.  Customer service awesome.  We ended up sitting for hours beat atmosphere! !!!
author: Felyca W.

description: I stumbled upon this hookah bar while in the city. The service was great and the flavors were really good. They played great music and if I am ever in town this is the hookah bar of my choice
author: Frank S.

description: Chill lounge, Awesome staff, and great flavors. The atmosphere of the place is really fantastic and once you get here you'll definitely want to come back. I haven't been to any good hookah lounges lately but this is by far the best one I've been too. I would recommend this for anyone who wants to come alone or even if you bring a big group. It's busy, that's for sure but that just proves how great the place is. 5 star lounge for sure.
author: Katherine S.

description: No ventilation, everything under smoke, wll never come again there is more better places near bei
author: Süleyman A.

description: Good hookah, best service
author: Thang P.

description: The staff is amazing.  It was my first time to this hookah bar from Sacramento.  I have never had service so fast. Sammy was so nice and Frank as well
author: Mya M.

description: Chill spot in the middle of an eclectic neighborhood. Service was super fast/friendly.
author: Kristophe C.

description: Do not go here. I called and this stupid guy answers and i say "hey is it ok if i come by and buy shisha ill be coming around 1:45" and they close at 2am. And he said yes for sure. Its 1:30 i go there early and im right in front of it and it says closed. dumb idiot worker
author: David L.

description: I love this place. It only took me one time to know that this was the vibe I was looking for. Staff is friendly and patient. They'll sit down and chat with you especially if you're a regular. I'd recommend this spot to anyone looking to start or cap off their night life
author: Kofi F.

description: Coming from New Jersey, this place is super cheap. You walk in tell them what you want pay for the hookah and find a seat. Very simple. If your looking for something super fancy and high end it's not here. Great place to get your hookah session and listen to some music. We enjoyed !
author: Emilio L.

description: Amazing customer service and fantastic hookah!!! The owner and workers.hung out with us the whole time we were here and very nice, professional and fun to talk to. Highly recomend. Great music and ambiance
author: Melissa R.

description: Solid place to come chill and enjoy some hookah with a group, definitely recommend it!
author: Jose L.

description: Went here a month ago and thought it was decent. Service on the slow side. Live entertainment was great.hookah was decent. Music was a little loud though. And it was pretty dark. I understand the ambience concept but I would of like a little better lighting and the music turned down a bit. It felt more like a club than lounge.
author: Brother B.

description: Great place awesome environment. The only play to go for good hookah in the city. Definitely a customer for life. Good job. Music playing awesome vibes
author: David S.

description: Pricey and not the best hookah place in San Francisco.
author: Edwin C.

description: great atmosphere and nice vibes an good customer service!  i honestly can say it's nice pricing an just a good place to relax an smoke
author: Sky S.

description: Smoked hookah there last night and was perfectly fine with me and my new girlfriend, visited San Rafael for just one night and liked it. San Rafael is the good city to visit.
author: Steven J.

description: Very relaxed atmosphere! Hookah was pretty good too. Also bought a house mix to go. i will definitely come back here upon my next trip to the area.
author: Nicoya V.

description: First timer ! Great service , we were greeted in a polite manner and serviced greatly.  Great hooka , try the speical mix number 5 !
author: Alliyah B.

description: It looked better online. The place is not very big and the music is a bit to loud.  Hookahs were good but they mAke you get one for every two people even if not everybody is going to smoke.
author: Jess C.

description:
I was impressed with this place.  The atmosphere was right for a hookah joint.  Low key, quiet, it was a place you could totally hang out with your friends and actually hear the things they say.  

The owner seemed super friendly and way on top of things.  He was able to keep track of everyone in the room and keep all the hookahs flowing.  He wasn't the sort to hide out behind a counter or anything either.  He would sit down and chat when things slowed down a bit for taking care of all the hookahs.
author: Leah R.

description: Great place. Fast service, nice staff calm vibe and good music would recommend for sure.
author: Courtney B.

description: Best hookah lounge ever! Can't be anybetter! It's a ONE BIG ROOM! Great music! Awesome DJ! Nice atmosphere! Great! If you haven't been to this spot then you are missing out Big Time! There's a big variety of hookah flavors it's so awesome! And it's a great place to hang out with friends!
author: Mahmoud A.

description: Newcomers from Southern California. Not used to hookah being so expensive but Marcus hooked it up with a sick group deal! Thanks for the good looks bruh.
author: Trevor D.

description: I only found two good hookah places during my stay in San Francisco and this was one of them. When I visit a new place, I need hookah and luckily I found a spot to smoke hookah, suprisingly there isn't that many in San Fransisco. But I must say this is the best hookah in the area! The atmosphere is really nice and their hookah pulls so good. The prices for the hookah are really good too and even with the refill for the hookah. This is the only hookah place that I ever been to that has rose as a flavor and I can't find that anywhere else but here. I love mixing rose lemon mint and their guava lemon mint is also a really nice mix. The best part of this place is their staff, by far one of the friendliest staffs I ever met, especially the one young guy working here. Great person to converse with and very cultured, you don't find that at many places. I know for a fact that this will be my go to hookah place for when I officially move out here!
author: Omed B.

description: First time here. Chill place with really good hookah. Good vibe and music. I especially like the service. Definitely coming again.
author: Rasha M.

description: Waste of time! As i hookah lover hookah was okay but the place is so dirty and unprofessional. And there are those signs that they say if you vomit they will charge 35$ cleaning fee, if you remove the clay head you will be asked to leave and etc. employees are sitting and smoking hookah, hookah hoses are worst quality ever they look like a straw sticked to a garden hose... !
author: Araz A.

description: Best hookah spot in sf. Awesome staff and great quality hookah. The vibe and atmosphere are great. Great music and cool atmosphere. If you're looking for an awesome spot in the city to smoke some hookah I highly recommend 724. Ask for Greek Gorilla, he's the best!  Ask for the Greek gorilla mix it's the best flavor.
author: Robhy B.

description: 724 hookah in SF interesting place. Yelp reviews are completely wrong in my opinion. This lounge is 3 stars at most. The hookah isn't that bad but that's not the only thing that makes a good lounge. Definitely not worth the price. This place is crazy small compared to most lounges in San Jose. The bowls seem to be pack pretty good but they put to much water and use small disposable hoses making the draw kinda tight. The pictures are of the old location. It no longer looks that way.
author: Antonio I.

description: It seems like I caught this place on a bad night. A friend and I decided to check this place out on a Monday night. The place seemed poorly maintained with trash remaining on the tables and no toilet paper in the bathrooms. We paid $20 for our guava white gummy bear and then sat and waited about 10 minutes for our coals and then had to hunt down a staff to get tongs because they seemed to like to either hang out in the back or sit at one of the booths with their friends and smoke. After we'd smoked our coals down to little pea size lumps, I ask the staff who was hanging out with his friends if we could get new coals and he bluntly tells me they're coming. 20 minutes later.. They don't come, so I wave down the guy who hides behind the counter. The coals come after about another 10 minutes from a guy who has his earphones in and hood pulled over his head, looking like he hates his job. The same process happens about two more times until we finally decided we had wasted enough time.
author: Krista C.

description: This place has a chill environment and is definitely enjoyable after a long day. I feel very relaxed and comfortable here and the prices are very good for how much you get. Highly recommend 724Hookah.
author: Alexis D.

description: Went there last week with friends. Prices are good and they use good shisha. Place is chill. Everything good but hot tea is too expensive. Otherwise a 5 star place.
author: Kourosh F.

description: I don't know why I keep doing this to myself, there are no good hookah bars in SF and this one is just like every other hookah bar. Not cozy, to top it all off, their hookah was terrible, we had to leave to a different hookah bar after 10 minutes
author: Anna P.

description: This place was disguised well, but we found it.  Had a great time smoking some great hookah with some good friends.
author: Jon F.

description: A great experience is what this place is! Very comfortable environment super chill staff and really bomb hookah flavors with a huge variety. Will definitely be here again!!!
author: La L.

description: Didn't expect place to be so good. Must visit after getting drunk in bar late night.
author: Malhar T.

description:
I've been here several times.  I mostly visit during the week but have also stopped by on the weekend.  I just started working in the FiDi so I usually swing by after work for their happy hour pricing.  

Weekdays are pretty quiet before 8.  The weekends are a little more rowdy - lots of high school aged kids.  I've seen a fight break out which is really strange for a hookah lounge.. especially since they don't serve alcohol.  

Staff is pretty friendly (hence the 2 stars) but the experience overall is consistently poor.  I've tried several different flavors and none of them hit very well.  Service is slow and inconsistent - I constantly have to get up and request changing of coals, problems with the hookah, etc.  I don't mind the staff socializing with friends and smoking but please don't let that detract from your attentiveness!

I think I've had enough.  This place gets points for location (meaning it's easy to get to on the bus... the neighborhood is pretty questionable) and friendliness.. but every time I come I feel like I've wasted my money.  No thanks!
author: Brittany D.

description: Hard to find but worth to do it :) Best shisha in the city! I mean it!
author: Nikolay S.

description: I love this place!!! Great atmosphere and good music. Great service overall and Adel offered us some awesome mixes.
author: Andy Z.

description: Tonight was the worst hookah experience I've encountered. The hookah was very harsh and hard to smoke. When I asked for someone to come over and check it for me they "forgot" to come. So I had to get up and ask again. After seating there for so long with a bad experience, I decided to just get a refund and leave. This place does not give refunds and they don't have a sign or anything to inform you. Also, I like to smoke it with a ice tip so it would be more smooth but they ran out. But my friends next to me had a ice tip but it wasn't frozen correctly. This place is really unorganized and shitty quality. Anyways the "manager" with the glasses is rude and very unprofessional. The other guy who claimed to be the next thing close to a "manager" was very nice and understanding of the situation. We ended up not getting our refund but received a voucher for next time.. But why would we come again, after having a bad experience. If you want cheap & shitty hookah and bad service this the place to go!!
author: Christy N.

description: It was okay. Friendly service but the door was part way open making it super cold. We did have to wait for fresh coals. And they kept asking  if we wanted our pic on their FB, after saying no several times. I wouldn't come back again and definitely not the best hooka
author: Jacklyn B.

description:
I generally hate to criticize a business, I just make a point not to patronize businesses that provide poor service.  However, in this case, I feel the need to warn everyone away from this place for issues ranging from incredibly slow service, broken hookahs with chewed off mouthpieces (gross!), and the cherry on top, sketchy hidden costs imposed after-the-fact (such as a minimum # of hookahs for a group and clean-up fees).  

After being passed over for a seat multiple times, then waiting over 30 minutes for 2 hookahs, we finally received our hookahs (one of which had the aforementioned mouthpiece that was so mangled we couldn't fit the plastic piece into it).  

Only a few minutes later, we were informed by our server, then by the owner (!) that we would now have to buy one more hookah because we were a large group despite the fact that the table next to us had the same number of people and hookahs.  This started the general impression that we were arbitrarily being hit with price hikes.  Also, being pestered with servers every few minutes, after being ignored for so long was pretty obnoxious.

This only continued as a friend of ours started feeling very light-headed and moved to go outside.  He tried to make it outside, but started to vomit as he went out the door.  Without hesitation, our server approached him and tried to hit him up for a cleaning fee of $25 dollars.  We brushed past the server to follow our friend outside and make sure he was ok. Another employee came out several minutes later and informed us it was now $30 for clean up.

In addition to the bro-y, cheap club ambiance, the repeated poor service, rude treatment, and price-hiking ensure that I won't be back. Steer clear of this place!
author: Jillian C.

description: A cool, chill place. My husband and I wanted to do the whole hookah experience and this lounge was the closest one we could find. We were hesitant at first because of the location and it looks a bit intimidating on the outside. However, once you go in, it's a decent establishment. The crowd is laid back and the staff is super friendly. I would come back again if I was in the area.
author: Alyssa B.

description: Ordered a mix of orange and vanilla not much flavor also they put way too much water in the hookah and it does not drag smoothly. The lounge is decorated great and the music playing is awesome. Staff is very knowledgable. Just tighten up your hookah making
author: Eugene K.

description: I went to this place when I was visiting the city and I really enjoyed it. I've been to other hookah places and nothing compares to this place. Great crowd and great hookah. Nice music most of the time. Definitely will be coming back every time I'm in the city.
author: Jarrell P.

description: I haven't been here since August, but when I did go it was very fun! I really like the decor inside, and everything is very well spaced out. The hookah was pretty good here. The only negative is the location, it is literally in one of the worst parts of town. But overall good atmosphere, good music, good hookah.
author: Nikita K.

description: Outrageous how rude and disrespectful the "manager" is here. Place sucks period. Saw the reviews figured I'd give it a shot, walk in no hostess to seat you, just a dude in the back with glasses couldn't be more  than 23 yrs old and clearly overwhelmed. He was helpful in recommending a decent flavor and the hookah was ok, but everything was a complete disaster from there. You pay up front for what you order, i paid for a Moroccan Tea to go with my hookah which never came. How long does it take to prepare a tea? I asked where the restroom was same ass clown manager points to the back but said someone was using it so i need to wait. Fine no problem, i wait about 10 min see the door slightly open so i decide to knock and not burst in. "WHAT!!!!!!!!" Jerk Manager screams from inside the bathroom.... I respond back i didn't realize someone was in here the door is open??? No answer i go back to my table still no tea...... WTF man i leave 1 dollar for the poor guys replacing coals and have to work for that bozo and walked out. F this place do yourself a favor and don't go.
author: Melvin H.

description: Hands down The Best hookah lounge in SF. Great service and nice owners who are not spending all their time trying to get in your underwear if you know what I mean. I tried to bring a group to Cairo nights but the owner was rude and their hookahs are some kind of electronic stone smoke, so forget them...
author: Florence M.

description:
Thank you, thank you so much Zach and Adul for letting me celebrate my birthday in your wonder establishment this Saturday. These two guys and their entire staff took outstanding good care of me and all my guest (and there were a lot of us).  Don't think I've ever been accommodated by an establishment like this before. From the time I called 724 Hookah and spoke to Adul I felt like I was in good hands. You were willing to work with me on everything I wanted to have a successful birthday and made sure we had a good time. Don't think I ever heard a "No We Can't Do That" from you guys.
 
EVERYONE really enjoyed themselves and raved how yummy and smooth the flavors of the hookahs were. We ordered at least seven different flavored Hookahs which everyone rotated. My favorite was a house special that had guava and rose in it. One of your staff members came around very often to make sure our coals were always hot. We never had to ask. 

I was also blown away of how nicely you set up a private area for us to hold my guest in. There was enough space to fit us all. The atmosphere was very nice and chill. The music was great!!! I think I learned a few new dance steps from your regular guests too
We are looking forward to coming back very soon. I really appreciate you guys for making everything run so smoothly for us. This will be a birthday to remember for a long time!!!
author: Carolyn D.

description:
I don't really know what to say but the hookah it's not just about the place that you set on it's also about the taste that you enjoy it and takes you far away from where you at .!! 
But this hookah sucks  
I'll just give these three starts for the guy that try to fix it for me but he did not but he at least smile for me lol that doesn't really worth the $19 that I paid for it cause that's kinda pricy  so I don't really wanna come here anymore
author: Laith A.

description: Nice chill spot, good selection of music, and not that expensive!
author: Jesus L.

description: The 12 is spot on... I have to agree with every review I've seen so far, and the people working were really attentive to our coals. After an hour and a half of four people splitting just one flavor, it was still hitting exactly the same as it was when we first started. There isn't much seating, but they some how work it out so every person can fit in the lounge. I would for sure come back because this place is really cool and has its own great style.
author: Michael M.

description:
i haven't had hookah since travelling to egypt and turkey several years ago. initially, i thought that no hookah bar will beat my past hookah bar experiences in the middle east but 724hookah surprisingly blew me away. 

walking past 724 geary, you would never think that the place was a hookah lounge. the huge sign above the door says "cigarettes cheaper" and the windows were covered with sheets. 

the service was fantastic. they had dozens of flavors to choose from and the hookah goes down really really well. my favorite is and has always been the apple mint. they take care of your coals frequently so the hookah never dies; your first puff is identical to your puff an hour later. the prices are very reasonable too!

this is definitely the place to hang out past midnight. next time my friends are in town, i am totally taking them here!
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: This is one of the best hookah bars I have ever been to. If you're ever in San Francisco and looking for a place to go this is the place. Their service is incredible and they keep the charcoal coming until you're ready to leave. They have a garret of flavors to choose from.  It's 15 dollars for a hookah, which is a great price. The atmosphere is relaxing and chill. Definitely my go to place.
author: Sarah W.

description:
This is a true hidden gem of a hookah bar. 

At first glance, it would be easy to pass by 724 without noticing it.  The sign above 724 that says "Cigarettes Cheaper" and the Pizza Hut next door give the passerby the impression that there is nothing of interest here.

Once inside, however, both novice hookah-partakers and connoisseurs alike can appreciate this hole-in-the-wall treasure.  The staff was immediately welcoming and courteous, and the comfortable couches, soft lighting, and internationally eclectic music all lend themselves to an overall relaxing atmosphere.

Another plus is 724 has many flavors to choose from, both classic and experimental.  We tried a combination of cherry and vanilla (delicious!)  along with the triple apple (didn't even know that existed!)

This is definitely a good spot to go if you are seeking a nice staff, upbeat and friendly crowd, and a place to smoke hookah comfortably.
author: Steph S.

description: This place is very hard to find and had the worst service ever.. I had to ask for charcoal over five times! That honestly got me irritated. I constantly go to hookah lounges to relax and enjoy myself I did not have a good time here! I've never had to actually get up from my seat to ask for charcoal at any lounge regardless of how busy they are. The restrooms were filthy and has a really bad oder. Overall my experience had horrible. Won't come back here again :(
author: Cash M.

description: Great hookah and friendly service. They made my visit very pleasant and I defiantly plan on returning here more often. Kudos to you gentleman!
author: Adelina G.

description: Such a chill hookah lounge in the CITY!  Great prices, plenty of room for big parties and best of all, they're OPEN LATE so it's always easy to swing by if you're out clubbing.
author: Combiz S.

description: This place is awesome! It's well decorated, comfortable, not expensive at all and the staff are GREAT! They are nice and they make you feel right at home!
author: Chad S.

description: Got Bad Service from a Different Hookah bar (marrakech) and Decided to take my Business elsewhere, I wound up at 724 Hookah Not only did they have Room for my 8 person group but they had GREAT Service Before we even walked in the door, it did'nt stop there though we intended to stay for 1-2 hours by 3A.M. we had to force ourselves to leave. all around they Have a great NO B.S. Environment with great service and to Top it all Off at the end of the night when it was time to pay the bill it was a fraction of the price we would have spent at the other hookah bar. An all around great experience i Fully recommend them i know they have a customer for life with me.
author: Devin D.

description: stays open late and serves good quality hookahs. It's my new go-to place for hookah
author: Azin D.

description: Good service and good hookahs. The music was cool. Mixed crowd cozy. 724 was recommended by yelp. Easy walk from the hotel.
author: Matt G.

description: Excellent service and great hookahs... Love what they've done with the place and all the new renovations. Highly recommend stopping by here to grab a hookah and enjoy the positive energy
author: Chris H.

description: I'm from LA and hookah here is pretty on point so I was a little worried about going to a hookah spot in SF. It's a nice little spot, the employees are all friendly and they were very attentive with the coals. I also liked it cause its freakin cheap! $15 for hookah, how could you go wrong with that. I'll be back there the next time I visit SF.
author: Diana A.

description: This spot is absolutely amazing and a great addition to the city! Not only are the hookahs top shelf in quality of tobacco, but the ambiance is one that I've never seen before as far as a hookah lounge is concerned. The decor is elegant with warm red tones throughout, the seats are very comfortable. There are two large flat screens on each side of the two surrounding walls where they often play music videos. The music is AWESOME! The service, VERY IMPRESSIVE given they are just getting started. The Grand Opening was just this past saturday when I was there and the turnout was unbelievable! They were extremely busy but seemed to cater to everyone as much as possible and as equally as possible and accomodated everyone that came through that door. People seemed to truly enjoy the place, and not feel rushed even as busy as it was. Great location and I definitely will be going back on a regular basis along with my friends! I KNOW this place is going to be a huge success! Way to go!
author: ST1223 T.

description: My friend and I wanted to hookah after dinner and drinks. This place is nearby to Union Square (as a reference point). It's a cute spot, nice vibe, has good music and super friendly staff! I'll be back!
author: Anna G.

description: It's good, spaciously.  Only wish they served drinks here with the hookahs.  Compared to hookah bars in New York, this one is meh...
author: Alyse S.

description: This place is the best shisha lounge I've been to in the United States. Great vibe, great music and the staff is second to none. They take care of their customers! Ask for Adel, he's "the man"
author: Joshua s.

description: some friends and i were in the city for the day and decided to try out one of their hookah spots. this was the nearest one to where we were staying so we decided to give it a shot. we were seated quickly and our hookah came to the table quickly but that was the only positive. we ordered premium blend flavors and after 4 or 5 pulls from the hookah the tobacco was awful! it tasted burnt and very low quality. it was making us gag after just a few hits. we got up and left without even finishing. 2 stars for having a decent interior and keeping the seats and tables cleaned.
author: Al J.

description: This place is terrible!!!!!! The worst hookah lounge I have ever been to...  I have been to many across the country and this is by faaaaaaar the worst.   Extremely filthy and way over priced.    Took them 30 min to get the hookah out.... Bathrooms were out of order..  hookah looked like it had never been cleaned.  Very very very disappointed..  not sure how they have slipped through with the health department .
author: SJ V.

description: If you are interested in; Overpacked, burned bowls, bad music on repeat and  a bunch of sweaty nasties jam packed into one spot, this is the place for you. Girls, beware, creepy men lurk around every corner aging from 18-85. Hookahs taste dirty, and metallic. They just keep putting coals, on top of coals, which gives off an unflattering harsh flavor.
author: Anon A.

description: Had a great time, there was just two of us. The hookah was super clean and smooth. Only complaint is it was a bit cold in there and the music was way too loud.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Just reiterating what everyone else has said. Hookah, in the city? This is the spot! The place is chillspot on weekdays and becomes amazing on the weekends. A great atmosphere for anyone (people who want to sit and talk and people who want to get up and dance). The music is good and unlike many other places in the city it loud enough to enjoy but not too loud as to be intrusive in peoples conversations.  The hookahs are very clean and flavors are very nice. The gem of this place, that distinguishes it from EVERY other hookah place in the city ... is the service. The guys running the place know how to run a business and they treat their customers no less than their friends. You'll see the owners going around introducing themselves and making sure if everything is good.  Im a regular there and on a name basis with these guys... not once have I had a complaint about this place. Anytime there is something wrong with the hookah, they make it a priority to fix it.   And I've been to every hookah bar in the city (and bay area), this place ranks at the top.  The only other place where I've seen as good a service is SmokeThis is SJ (which I think is partially owned by the same person.. so go figure)

They carry the usual fruity mixes people love, and they also have Nakhla's Double Apple that us old arab fogies love.

The prices are very reasonable, very nice decor, seats are plentiful - and they dont play musical chairs with their customers... moving people around to seat others, they always try to accommodate. Free WiFi and TVs. Without being too much of an advertisement, its a place where you gotta try it to believe it!
author: F S.

description: Great service great hookah definitely coming back ! Great place to come and relax with friends. Will recommend this to everyone I know.
author: Jay M.

description: First time here and the hookah was subpar. It was thin and got harsh very quickly. The staff did not replace the coals in a timely manner and it was not milky enough to do any tricks.
author: Leilani O.

description: 724Hookah has become one of my favorite neighborhood spots for relaxing with friends and catching up on life while relaxing.  The staff is insanely nice and makes it feel like family.  The hookahs are great and at a great price.  I enjoy coming here in the early evenings when they first open and it's pretty quiet.  They do get packed and become more of a social space later at night on the weekends, which is also pretty awesome.
author: Miguel V.

description: Dope place with great ambience, weekends are best for your visit day. A variety of different hookah flavors are bound to satisfy your smoking craves.
author: Gerson L.

description: Best hookah lounge in the bay area!! Service is amazing, the staff is always walking around and checking in making sure the charcoals and flavor is good. Hookahs are clean. Staff is very nice and start conversations, also very knowledgable about the flavors with good recommendations. The place is very spacious, good for big parties and has a warm feeling with red curtains and red walls. They also have two tv's and always playing good music that isn't obnoxiously loud. The owners zaki and abdul are very nice and welcoming, if you ever have an issue they will try their best to fix it. These guys know how to run a business and keep ever happy. Thank you!!
author: Viktor M.

description: Best place ever! Chilliest environment and the guy who helped us gave us a beautiful blend! Stop by if you are in the sf area for a good hookah and a good time
author: Shannon H.

description: My friend did not get in because he lost his ID and had to wait in the car, they will not let you in even if you do look over 25 and my birthday and his birthday week apart and thats a bummer. They make you get 2 hookahs for 5 people. You can mix flavors, I think we got rose and lavender and some fruit flavor and it tasted nice. Sanitary, they give you plastic mouth pieces for the hose. They play music videos on big screens but it is what they want to play.
author: Stephanie W.

description: hookah was ok . atmospphere was kinda cool. tons of neat little leds . loud music with tv playing but you cant hear it  haha. i wish i could actually listen to the tv instead of reading lips if theyre gunna have a tv they should do music videos
author: Cassandra P.
